hook.text: For decades, fashion magazines showed one body type and one skin tone. Photography decided who was visible.

buildup.text: The people who appear in photographs ‚Äî and how they appear ‚Äî shapes cultural notions of beauty and normality.

discovery.text: Movements for diversity in photography pushed for broader representation of body types, races, and abilities.

twist.text: Representation isn't just about who's in the photo. It's about who's behind the camera making creative decisions.

climax.text: When marginalized communities photograph themselves, images tell fundamentally different stories than outsider views.

punchline.text: Who holds the camera decides who the world sees.

quiz.question: Why does diversity behind the camera matter as much as in front of it?
options: Photographers from different backgrounds tell fundamentally different stories
